author: Mehboob Jeelani
text:
He will have one-to-one meetings with Gurudas Kamat and Sanjay Nirupam

Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi’s schedule for his two-day Mumbai trip —starting from Friday — is mostly packed with meetings with party workers.

The reason: the ongoing intra-party rift in the city unit is affecting the daily functioning of the party.

Congress sources said Mr. Gandhi “squeezed” meetings with other people and decided to devote the entire Friday to meet the two estranged factions —one led by Gurudas Kamat and other by the State unit president Sanjay Nirupam, who came under the scanner of the party’s disciplinary committee after an article heavily critical of the Gandhi family appeared in its state mouthpiece “Mumbai Sandesh” last December.

“Rahulji will meet both sides,” said a senior Congress leader.
title: Rahul’s Mumbai visit aimed at resolving intra-party rift
